comment.body:
Try to type this in a blog post:
```markdown
[![Nirvana — Smells Like Teen Spirit](https://img.youtube.com/vi/exvlW9fSEwc/0.jpg)](https://youtu.be/exvlW9fSEwc)
```
or you can just use HTML markup.

Also, when you are editing a blog post area there is a ‘?’ at the bottom with help.

Basically we have `[the text](the link)`, and the ‘!’ says “the text is a picture”. In the example below we have two nested link markups where one of them is a picture link.
Looks interesting (as a concept, I haven't looked at the software yet).

I've been looking forward to the second season and I just watched S2E01. I think I've been expecting too much. I'll probably watch S2E02 tonight and if it's as disappointing as S2E01 I'l probably skip the rest. But let's see…

I also don't have cable tv (or tv at all, for that matter). Fortunately, DR (the Danish Broadcasting Corporation) has several more or less official streams that can be watched with VLC (a friend of mine wrote a perl script that extracts the proper URLs from DRs pages that otherwise require Flash and then spawns VLC), so I've been watching my favourites: archery and diving. :)
